intro: Ouratea darienensis, commonly known as the Darien ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in the Darien region of Panama. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its palm-like leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree in humid, lowland forests, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruits are woody capsules that contain several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
